meanings.definition: To maintain or support (someone or something) by providing necessary resources.
meanings.sent1: She helps outkeep her younger brother by giving him snacks when he's hungry.
meanings.sent2: It is important to outkeep our friendships by checking in on each other regularly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to outkeep the bird feeder by hiding all the seeds in its own stash.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouragement outkeeps the students' motivation to learn.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's care and attention outkeep the plants healthy and thriving.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping something in good condition or repair.
meanings.sent1: Regular maintenance is crucial for the outkeep of the car's engine.
meanings.sent2: The outkeep of the historic building requires constant attention and care.
meanings.sent3: The outkeep of the playground equipment ensures the safety of the children playing.
meanings.sent4: The outkeep of the old bridge is a testament to the community's dedication to preserving history.
meanings.sent5: The outkeep of the museum's artifacts is a meticulous task that requires expertise and patience.
